n. 怀疑的态度：a doubting or questioning attitude or state of mind; dubiety
【注】该词也可拼作：scepticism

sketchy.value: adj. 大概的，不完全的，不充分的：lacking in substance or completeness; incomplete

slight.value:
v. 轻视，轻蔑：to treat as of small importance; make light of
adj. 轻微的；少量的；小的：small in size, degree, or amount
adj. 不结实的，脆弱的：lacking strength, substance, or solidity; frail
adj. 微不足道的；不太重要的：of small importance or consideration; trifling
【考】slighted；slightly

sluggish.value:
adj. 缓慢的：displaying little movement or activity; slow; inactive
adj. 懒散的：lacking alertness, vigor, or energy; inert or indolent

speculative.value:
adj. 理论的： theoretical rather than demonstrable
adj. 推测性的，猜测性的：given to conjecture or speculation
adj. 带着疑问的，好奇的：marked by questioning curiosity

startling.value: adj. 令人吃惊的，惊人的，不寻常的: causing momentary fright, surprise, or astonishment

stratify.value:
v. 使分层：to form, arrange, or deposit in layers; to arrange or separate into castes, classes, or social levels
【派】stratification  n.（尤指社会的）分层，形成阶层
【考】stratified；stratification

strength.value:
n. 力量，力气：the state, property, or quality of being strong
n. 优势，优点，长处：a strong attribute or inherent asset
【注】注意短语on the strength of在…基础上；在…的影响下；凭借；依赖；
例如：On the strength of those grades, he won a scholarship to Syracuse University. 凭借那些成绩，他赢得了锡拉丘兹大学的奖学金。
【考】strength；strengths

substitute.value:
n. 替代品，代替者，代替物: one that takes the place of another; a replacement
v. 用…代替，取代，替换：to put or use (a person or thing) in place of another
【注】注意短语搭配：令人满意的替代物；与之媲美的事物：if you say that one thing is no substitute for another, you mean that it does not have certain desirable features that the other thing has, and is therefore unsatisfactory. If you say that there is no substitute for something, you mean that it is the only thing which is really satisfactory
例如：The printed word is no substitute for personal discussion with a great thinker.阅读印在纸上的内容远不如与伟大的思想家面对面探讨那般受益。
【考】substitutes；substituted

supersede.value:
v. 代替，取代：to take the place of; replac
【考】superseded

suppress.value:
v. 镇压，制止，压制: to put an end to forcibly; subdue
v. 制止，阻止，抑制: to inhibit the expression of (an impulse, for example); check

surfeit.value: n. 过量，过多：an overabundant supply : excess

surreptitious.value:
adj. 鬼鬼祟祟的;偷偷摸摸的：obtained, done, or made by clandestine or stealthy means
【考】surreptitious ；surreptitiousness

swift.value: adj. 迅速的：moving or capable of moving with great speed; fast

synoptic.value: adj. 大纲性的，概要的：of or constituting a synopsis; presenting a summary of the principal parts or a general view of the whole

taciturn.value:
adj. 寡言少语的；沉默寡言的；不苟言笑的：temperamentally disinclined to talk
【派】taciturnity  n. 缄默，沉默寡言
【考】taciturn；taciturnity

tangible.value:
adj. 通过触摸可以感知的；可触知的：capable of being perceived especially by the sense of touch: palpable
adj. 能感觉到的：capable of being precisely identified or realized by the mind
adj. 确实的，真实的：possible to be treated as fact; real or concrete

tedious.value:
adj. 枯燥的；乏味的；令人生厌的：tiresome by reason of length, slowness, or dullness; boring
【派】tedium  n. 枯燥，无聊，乏味
【考】tedious；tedium

temperate.value:
adj. 自我克制的：exercising moderation and self-restraint
adj. (行为)温和的，心平气和的，平心静气的：moderate in degree or quality; restrained
adj. (气候)温和的；(地区)温带的：having a moderate climate which especially lacks extremes in temperature

tenuous.value:
adj. (理由)站不住脚的，牵强的；(地位)不稳固的：having little substance or strength : flimsy, weak, shaky
【考】tenuous；tenuously

tout.value:
v. 吹捧，吹嘘, 引起公众对…的注意：to promote or praise energetically; publicize
v. 兜售，拉票，招徕：to solicit customers, votes, or patronage, especially in a brazen way
【考】touted

tractable.value: adj. 易驾驭的，易管教的：easily managed or controlled; governable

tranquil.value:
adj. 内心平静的：free from agitation of mind or spirit
adj. 平静的；安静的；宁静的：free from disturbance or turmoil
【派】tranquility  n. 平静；安宁；安静

trifling.value: adj. 不重要的；微不足道的：of slight worth or importance: trivial

trivialize.value:
v. 贬低；轻视；使显得琐碎（或简单）：to make something seem less important or serious than it really is
【考】trivialized；triviality

unanticipated.value: adj. 未预料到的，意料之外的：not anticipated : unexpected, unforeseen

unchecked.value: adj. 未被遏制的；未受到抑制的：not held in check; unrestrained

understate.value:
v. 不充分如实地陈述；对…轻描淡写；打折扣地说：to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important or serious than it really is
【考】understated；understating

unpretentious.value:
adj. 谦逊的，朴素的：free from ostentation, elegance, or affectation : modest
【考】unpretentious；unpretentiousness

unproductive.value:
adj. 没有好结果的；徒然的：not achieving very much
adj. 贫瘠的，不毛的：lacking or unable to produce growing plants or crops

unsympathetic.value:
adj. （对主张或目标）反对的，不支持的：if you are unsympathetic to a particular idea or aim, you are not willing to support it
adj. 冷漠的；不体恤人的；无同情心的：if someone is unsympathetic, they are not kind or helpful to a person in difficulties.  
adj. 讨厌的；难缠的：an unsympathetic person is unpleasant and difficult to like

untenable.value: adj. （论点或立场）经不起反驳的，站不住脚的：an argument, theory, or position that is untenable cannot be defended successfully against criticism or attack

valedictory.value:
adj. 告别的：of, relating to, or expressing a valedictory
n. （优秀生在毕业典礼上作的）告别演说：a closing or farewell statement or address, especially one delivered at graduation exercises
【考】valedictory ；valedictions

variable.value:
adj. 多变的;易变的;反复无常的：Likely to change or vary; subject to variation; changeable; inconstant; fickle
n. 变量;变项;变元：A variable is a quantity that can have any one of a set of values.

venerable.value:
adj. 神圣庄严的：worthy of reverence, especially by religious or historical association
adj. 值得敬重的，令人崇敬的：commanding respect by virtue of age, dignity, character, or position
【考】venerable；veneration

verifiable.value: adj. 可证实的；可核实的：something that is verifiable can be proved to be true or genuine.

vexation.value:
n. 恼怒，烦恼：the act of annoying, irritating, or vexing
【考】vexation；vexatious

vicious.value:
adj. 邪恶的：having the nature of vice; evil, immoral, or depraved
adj. 凶猛的：marked by an aggressive disposition; savage. Used chiefly of animals

vilify.value:
v. 污蔑，诋毁：to make vicious and defamatory statements about; defame
【考】vilify；vilified

vital.value:
adj. 必要的;至关重要的;必不可少的：necessary to continued existence or effectiveness; essential
adj. 充满活力的;生气勃勃的：imparting life or animation; invigorating

volatile.value:
adj. 易挥发的：evaporating readily at normal temperatures and pressures
adj. 活泼的，轻快的：lighthearted; flighty
adj. 易变的;动荡不定的;反复无常的：characterized by or subject to rapid or unexpected change
adj. 短暂的：difficult to capture or hold permanently : evanescent, transitory
【考】volatile ；volatility

yield.value:
v. 生产，产出：to give forth by or as if by a natural process, especially by cultivation
v. 获利：to furnish as return for effort or investment; be productive of
v. 放弃，投降：to give over possession of, as in deference or defeat; surrender
n. 生产量，生产物：an amount yielded or produced; a product
v. 被…替代；为…所取代：if one thing yields to another thing, it is replaced by this other thing
v. 产生（结果）；得出（信息）：if something yields a result or piece of information, it produces it

abate.value:
v. 减少，降低：to reduce in amount, degree, or intensity; lessen
【考】abated

aberration.value: n. 偏离正常，非典型行为：a departure from the normal or typical

abridged.value:
adj. 削减的；删节的：an abridged book, play etc has been made shorter but keeps its basic structure and meaning
【派】abridgment    n. 节本，删节版

abstemious.value:
adj. 节制的，适度饮食的： marked by restraint especially in the consumption of food or alcohol 
【考】abstemiousness

accentuate.value:
v. 强调，使更明显：to stress or emphasize; intensify ,to make something more noticeable
【考】accentuate；accentuates

accord.value:
v. 给予；授予：to grant or give especially as appropriate, due, or earned
v. （与…）一致，符合：to be in agreement, unity, or harmony

adduce.value: v.举例； 引证：to cite as an example or means of proof in an argument

adjunct.value: n. 附属物，辅助物： something attached to another in a dependent or subordinate position

admonish.value: v. 告诫：to express warning or disapproval to especially in a gentle, earnest, or solicitous manner

adulation.value:
n.  谄媚；恭维：excessive or slavish admiration or flattery; adulation is uncritical admiration and praise of someone or something 
【派】self-adulation    自我吹嘘，自我吹捧
               adulate   v. 过分地称赞或恭维
【考】adulating；adulation

affinity.value:
n.  相似；熟悉：if you have an affinity with someone or something, you feel that you are similar to them or that you know and understand them very well
【考】affinity；affinities

aggressive.value:
adj. 有闯劲的；积极进取的：marked by driving forceful energy or initiative : enterprising
adj. 好斗的；挑衅的：an aggressive person or animal has a quality of anger and determination that makes them ready to attack other people
【派】aggression    n. 进攻；侵犯；敌对行为

alacrity.value: n. 敏捷；欣然，乐意：quickness or celerity; cheerful readiness

alienation.value: n. 疏远：the act of alienating or the condition of being alienated; estrangement

alleviate.value: v. 减轻：to make (pain, for example) more bearable :relieve, lessen

ambivalence.value: n. 同时存在相反的感情或者态度（比如又爱又恨）；矛盾心理：the coexistence of opposing attitudes or feelings, such as love and hate, toward a person, an object, or an idea.

amend.value: v. 修正，修订（如一种立法措施）：to alter (a legislative measure, for example) formally by adding, deleting, or rephrasing
